edu.nau.elc.hardlinks.domain

Class CourseProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.String>
      • edu.nau.elc.hardlinks.domain.CourseProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, java.util.concurrent.Future<java.lang.Void>, java.util.concurrent.RunnableFuture<java.lang.Void>

    public class CourseProcessor
extends javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.String>
    One instance of GetLinks is constructed for each export file to process. It begins processing when doInBackground() is called.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class javax.swing.SwingWorker

        javax.swing.SwingWorker.StateValue

    • Method Detail

      • buildDOM

        private void buildDOM(java.io.File manifest)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                      javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        This takes a bb-manifest.xml and gives us a DOM of the course content structure.
        Parameters:
        manifest - bb-manifest.xml file we want to parse.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the manifest file can't be read.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - If it's not valid XML.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - Ask the JDK why this gets thrown.

      • doInBackground

        public java.lang.Void doInBackground()
                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                     org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                                     javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        Begins background processing of the ZIP export.
        Specified by:
        doInBackground in class javax.swing.SwingWorker<java.lang.Void,java.lang.String>
        Returns:
        Nothing.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If a file in the ZIP can't be read.
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - If we encounter invalid XML that SAX can't parse at all.
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - If for some bizarre reason we can't configure the parser.

      • writeResults

        private void writeResults(java.lang.String outPath,
                          java.util.ArrayList<CourseItem> content,
                          java.util.ArrayList<CourseItem> htmlFiles,
                          java.util.ArrayList<CourseItem> undeployed)
        Writes our results to an Excel sheet. Is a bit of a beast because POI doesn't have the most concise syntax. Fairly tightly coupled to the CourseItem and Link implementations, but can definitely be tweaked if need be. All styling and formatting is handled in code, rather than configuration, since this is only used a few dozen times a semester.
        Parameters:
        outPath - The path to write the report to (usually is the path of the export file as well).
        content - A list of all content items found in the course.
        htmlFiles - A list of all HTML files found in the content collection which are deployed in the course.
        undeployed - A list of all HTML files found in the content collection which are not deployed.

      • extractAllFiles

                             java.lang.String outputDir)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Extract's all ZIP files to a directory, preserving the internal structure of the archive.

      • getHTMLFiles

        private java.util.ArrayList<CourseItem> getHTMLFiles(java.io.File[] files)
                                              throws java.io.IOException,
                                                     org.xml.sax.SAXException
        Get a flat list of all HTML files from an array of files at the root of an unzipped course export.
        Parameters:
        files - Array listing all files at the root of the course export.
        Returns:
        a list of all files ending in .html or .htm in the course export

      • sanitizeXIDFilenames

        private void sanitizeXIDFilenames(java.io.File dir)
        Remove xid strings from all content collection filenames. Makes getting the xid a little trickier, but simplifies seraching filesnames. Recursive, so may StackOverflow if used on an incredibly deep hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        dir - The directory to sanitize, usually the content collection root in the export.

      • deleteDirectory

        private void deleteDirectory(java.io.File dir)
        Delete directory and all contained files and subdirectories (recursive, will StackOverflow on very deep trees.
        Parameters:
        dir - Directory to delete.
